title: Lough Eske Walk Route

images.title: Brian Shaw / Lough Eske
images.caption: Lough Eske in summer. The lake and its tributaries are popular for fishing, especially for spring salmon, sea trout and char, with the season running from 1 March to 30 September

images.title: South-western shore of Lough Eske by D Gore, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: South-western shore of Lough Eske

images.title: Harvey’s Point on Lough Eske (2) by D Gore, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Harvey’s Point on Lough Eske

images.title: Lough Eske near Harvey's Point by louise price, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Lough Eske near Harvey's Point

description: This walk visits the beautiful Lough Eske in County Donegal. The route starts of at the impressive Lough Eske Castle on the western side of the lake. The 5 star hotel is a nice place to relax and enjoy an afternoon tea after the walk. Head east from the castle and you can pick up a section of the Bluestack Way, a long distance walking trail running through the area. The trail runs along the western side of the lake and through the adjacent woodland. You'll pass Harvey's Point where there are tremendous views across the water to the surrounding hills.
